Student.Notes:
Claimed headache on 25 Nov so I excused the absence even though she's weak and plagiarizes.
Wrote me on 19 Jan 2017: Dear Mr. Andre, My name is Dang Lam Oanh from CityU 2B class. Today, I write this email to inform you about checking my attendance in Business Law subject: Firstly,in the two sessions of the first week, I studied at CityU 3B class, but not checking attendance because of no official list. From the second week, my name has been recorded in official list of CityU 3A class, so I turned to this class to study. I am so sorry because I moved from this class to that class without notifying for you. Next, I missed two sessions on Thursday 27 October and 4 November because I had to take part in Ethics and Leadership subject of City University. I hope that you can consider and check again my attendance. In addition, I wish Mrs. Thu confirmed to above things. Best regard,
Đặng Thị Lâm Oanh

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve PASS, student must show clear understanding of all pass outcomes.
The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 1 out of 5 -- unacceptable) Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Some slides are good but others have too much text. You could have gotten a higher score but missing so many workshops limited you.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student should learn how to properly create a "works cited" page. Read chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Should have better evidence for decisions made
Good references
Test should be more researched
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
Only "missing" websites used
Need to fix formatting issues
Do not depend on "easy websites" - use books and journal articles

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT and DISTINCTION outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
Keep up the good work! All references used in writing should be included on a reference list at the end of the work. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) It is important to speak clearly, making sure words do not slur or run together. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) English is very different in the way it is pronounced, so more practice will help you improve. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Ideas should be supported by proper research (avoid unsupported opinion). (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Research should not only appear on slides, it should be integrated into what a presenter says. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Improving your presentation skills will improve your grade
Clear difference shown
Your observations should connect to some reasonable criteria for evaluation
Nice research included
Good integration of research
Summary and supporting references both good
Need to talk more about the research you are referencing
Good quantitative factors, more qualitative would be better
Nice details, nice evaluation
Good that you included some research
Have more books and journal articles as references
Better if answers showed more complex understanding
Steady improvement during semester
Could be even more perspectives by reading more
Good research throughout
Try to create something crazy sometimes

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper introduction. Read chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to include a proper conclusion. Read chapter about "How to write a conclusion." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

Test was unclear
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. There should be a good balance between using student's own ideas and the ideas of others as support. For more information, students can read the chapter about "Showing Understanding" and "The 80/20 rule." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Academic argument is about using a student's own ideas and then supporting those ideas with proper evidence. For more information, students can read the chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) English uses tone in a different way and using only one flat tone (monotone) makes it difficult to understand a presenter. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Watch text wrapping on multiple lines in one cell.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to improve understanding of paragraph. Read chapter about "How to write a paragraph." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Why IT?
More research and more references would be better
Should be more specific to this job
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
References were all websites
Need to fix formatting issues
Do not depend on "easy websites" - use books and journal articles

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. All writing should include a proper introduction. More information can be found in the chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Everything cited in the text must be in the references list and everything in the references list must be cited in text. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) All references used in writing should be included on a reference list at the end of the work. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to speak clearly, making sure words do not slur or run together. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Be careful about verb tenses.

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Cover less content to improve presentation quality
Clear difference shown
Evaluation needs more information
Should include more research references
You are expected to do some research
Good use of supporting references
More examples would help
Should have more detail in measurement levels
Could prioritize each sub-criteria by giving different points to different sub-criteria
Need to integrate research with your writing more
Good use of research in workshops
Better if answers showed more complex understanding
Presentations were good but writing could be better
Need more research to achieve this
Needs some additional research to achieve this
Experiement more with unique ideas

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Watch details of your writing, including spelling, capitalization, and punctuation. Details are important. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Should include more detailed information
Ethics are not the same as the law
Should put less text on slides
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
No references at all
Need to improve presentation skills
Needs some research to achieve this

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Details like spelling, capitalization, and punctuation are important. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements.
The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)

Watch spelling errors, they are bad

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Performance criteria needs clearer levels
Should relate more to your previous presentations
Test should be more researched
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
References were all websites

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT and DISTINCTION outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
Keep up the good work! There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) All references used in writing should be included on a reference list at the end of the work. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to speak clearly, making sure words do not slur or run together. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A scale with 5 levels might be easier for the audience to understanding.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements.
The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Ideas should be supported by proper research (avoid unsupported opinion). (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Research should not only appear on slides, it should be integrated into what a presenter says. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Watch for grammar and spelling mistakes on the slides.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. There should be a good balance between using student's own ideas and the ideas of others as support. For more information, students can read the chapter about "Showing Understanding" and "The 80/20 rule." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Should integrate more research into your reflective writing.
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) In English we breathe more which means we pronounce the final sound more strongly. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Black text on orange background can be difficult to read.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. All writing should include a proper introduction. More information can be found in the chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Everything cited in the text must be in the references list and everything in the references list must be cited in text. (your performance level: 1 out of 5 -- unacceptable) There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to speak clearly, making sure words do not slur or run together. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper introduction. Read chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve English skills. As a second language, you will need to continue to develop this skill (writing and speaking). (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Students needs to understand the difference between assessing/evaluating and reporting. Read chapter on "Common Task Verbs" (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Performance criteria should be objectively measurable
Should give more detail with explanations
Good questions
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
No references at all
Need to fix formatting issues
Needs some research to achieve this

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT and DISTINCTION outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
Keep up the good work! There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) All references used in writing should be included on a reference list at the end of the work. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Ideas should be supported by proper research (avoid unsupported opinion). (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Research should not only appear on slides, it should be integrated into what a presenter says. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Slides had a little too much text.

Clear difference shown
Should have more reflection, even when your leadership was successful

Could have more references and more examples
Detailed evidence, relavant references
Too much detail takes too long to explain, keep it short
Measurement levels were good but other areas were weak
Evaluation was a little off because of teamwork issues
Good research but referencing is messy
Good use of research in workshops
Detailed complex answers throughout
Presentations and writing both very good
Could be even more perspectives by reading more
Good research throughout
Try to create something crazy sometimes

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. All writing should include a proper introduction. More information can be found in the chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Details like spelling, capitalization, and punctuation are important. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
Student should learn how to properly use in-text citations. Read chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 1 out of 5 -- unacceptable) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)

Seemed very unprepared
Slides not easy to read
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
References were all websites
Need to fix formatting issues

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. All writing should include a proper introduction. More information can be found in the chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Watch for spelling mistakes on slides.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper conclusion. Read chapter about "How to write a conclusion." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Performance criteria should be objectively measurable
Need to focus on recruitment process
Do not read your slides when presenting
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
No references at all
Need to fix formatting issues
Needs some research to achieve this

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT and DISTINCTION outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
Keep up the good work! All writing should include a proper introduction. More information can be found in the chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) All writing should include a proper conclusion. More information can be found in the chapter about "How to write a conclusion." (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more)
The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) In English we breathe more which means we pronounce the final sound more strongly. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Ideas should be supported by proper research (avoid unsupported opinion). (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) You can split content across multiple slides.

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Practice more so you don't need to look at slides
Very practical way of showing different approaches
More research to support your ideas
Try presenting like you are telling a story to your friend
Good integration of knowledge, experience, and research
Research, examples, and evidence were all great
More connection between your thoughts would help
Need more supporting ideas
PDP should have a timescale when you evaluate if the improvement was made
Need to integrate research with your writing more
Good use of research
Better if answers showed more complex understanding
Presentations were good but writing could be better
Could be even more perspectives by reading more
More research in your writing would help
Try to create something crazy sometimes

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements.
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) It is important to speak clearly, making sure words do not slur or run together. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Nice slides by format 3.3 not 3,3.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Watch details of your writing, including spelling, capitalization, and punctuation. Details are important. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

Good overall but second law was a bit weak

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Presentation should be completed within time limits. Do not go too fast or too slow. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Nice slides.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper introduction. Read chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to include a proper conclusion. Read chapter about "How to write a conclusion." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Better to reference in Harvard format
Only use English in presentations
Question needs more research
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
Good references in workshops
Need to fix formatting issues
Do not depend on "easy websites" - use books and journal articles

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Everything cited in the text must be in the references list and everything in the references list must be cited in text. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Research should not only appear on slides, it should be integrated into what a presenter says. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)

Try to be more creative and take more risks

Need to show more complex understanding

Needs some additional research to achieve this

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) All references used in writing should be included on a reference list at the end of the work. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) English is very different in the way it is pronounced, so more practice will help you improve. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great)

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to use more academic evidence in writing. Read chapter about "Showing Understanding" and "The 80/20 rule." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to include a proper introduction. Read chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should learn how to properly use in-text citations. Read chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should learn how to properly create a "works cited" page. Read chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Good connection to research
Good choice of ethical issues
Question too simple, answer good

Good references in workshops

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true must be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Academic argument is about using a student's own ideas and then supporting those ideas with proper evidence. For more information, students can read the chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) English is very different in the way it is pronounced, so more practice will help you improve. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Great slides.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper conclusion. Read chapter about "How to write a conclusion." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should understand how to only use good quality sources for evidence. Wikipedia and other anonymous writings are not ideal sources. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should read the original source (original article, etc.) and not rely on third parties. If you cannot find the original source, ask your lecturer. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should learn how to properly use in-text citations. Read chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper conclusion. Read chapter about "How to write a conclusion." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of paragraph. Read chapter about "How to write a paragraph." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should improve understanding of difference between descriptive analysis and critical analysis. Read chapter about "How to show understanding" (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Why IT?
Analysis could be more critical
Should be more specific to this job
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
References were all websites
Need to fix formatting issues
Do not depend on "easy websites" - use books and journal articles

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT and DISTINCTION outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
Keep up the good work!
The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) It is important to speak clearly, making sure words do not slur or run together. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Ideas should be supported by proper research (avoid unsupported opinion). (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Research should not only appear on slides, it should be integrated into what a presenter says. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Nice text on slides, could be less.

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Evaluate based on criteria, not "in my opinion"
Clear difference shown
Good, relevant research
Should include more research references
Good point about sharing burden
Try to dig a little deeper to show more complex understanding
Should have more examples from your team
Could separate sub-criteria
Good and constructive comments
Need to integrate research with your writing more
Good use of research
Better if answers showed more complex understanding
Presentations and writing both very good
Could be even more perspectives by reading more
More research in your writing would help
Try to create something crazy sometimes

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. Everything cited in the text must be in the references list and everything in the references list must be cited in text. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) All references used in writing should be included on a reference list at the end of the work. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Ideas should be supported by proper research (avoid unsupported opinion). (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Research should not only appear on slides, it should be integrated into what a presenter says. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more)

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper introduction. Read chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Should have greater variety of references
Still discriminating against people with HIV
Consider the situation more for the questions
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
References were all websites
Need to fix formatting issues
Do not depend on "easy websites" - use books and journal articles

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. Academic argument is about using a student's own ideas and then supporting those ideas with proper evidence. For more information, students can read the chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) All references used in writing should be included on a reference list at the end of the work. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 1 out of 5 -- unacceptable) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) English is very different in the way it is pronounced, so more practice will help you improve. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Cover less content to improve presentation quality
Creative way to show differences
Good detailed evidence provided
Should include more research references
More detailed examples would be better
Nice linking to research
Need to talk more about the research you are referencing
Measurement levels should be more consistent
Sub-criteria should be more detailed
Need to integrate research with your writing more
Have more books and journal articles as references
Better if answers showed more complex understanding
Presentations could be a little better
Need more research to achieve this
Needs some additional research to achieve this
Experiement more with unique ideas

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true must be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Academic argument is about using a student's own ideas and then supporting those ideas with proper evidence. For more information, students can read the chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to speak clearly, making sure words do not slur or run together. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT and DISTINCTION outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
Keep up the good work! There should be a good balance between using student's own ideas and the ideas of others as support. For more information, students can read the chapter about "Showing Understanding" and "The 80/20 rule." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Text was a little small but slides had nice graphics.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve PASS, student must submit all pass outcomes.
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Presentation should be completed within time limits. Do not go too fast or too slow. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Images on slides did not help make your point, they just distracted the audience.

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Need much more research, not just unsupported opinions
Analysis should be more critical
Good question, weak test

References were all websites
Good presentation

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements.
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) In English we breathe more which means we pronounce the final sound more strongly. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) English is very different in the way it is pronounced, so more practice will help you improve. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Nice slides.

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: How do you know how strong / good you are?
Clear difference shown

Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great)

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. There should be a good balance between using student's own ideas and the ideas of others as support. For more information, students can read the chapter about "Showing Understanding" and "The 80/20 rule." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Academic argument is about using a student's own ideas and then supporting those ideas with proper evidence. For more information, students can read the chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Nice text on slides. Do more like this.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper introduction. Read chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to understand that everything cited in the text must be in the references page and everything in the references page must be cited in text. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should learn how to properly use in-text citations. Read chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should learn how to properly create a "works cited" page. Read chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Performance criteria should be objectively measurable
Do not just read, explain in your own words
Personality tests are not a reliable way to evaluate someone else
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
Good references in workshops
Need to fix formatting issues
Needs some additional research to achieve this

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. The quality of sources used for evidence is important. Websites and anonymous writings are not good sources but books and journal articles are. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Needs more real examples
Good use of narration to add analysis
Need more detail on everything
Should be more connected to meaning
Paraphrase research to better integrate into your answer
Integrate references to give better answers
More analysis on examples would show more understanding
Nice use of clear numbers
PDP should have a timescale when you evaluate if the improvement was made
Good research but referencing is messy
Research could be done better
Better if answers showed more complex understanding
Need to improve referencing in writing
Need more research to achieve this
Needs some additional research to achieve this
Experiement more with unique ideas

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper conclusion. Read chapter about "How to write a conclusion." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should understand how to only use good quality sources for evidence. Wikipedia and other anonymous writings are not ideal sources. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should learn how to properly use in-text citations. Read chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Watch details of your writing, including spelling, capitalization, and punctuation. Details are important. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: "Any disease" is too broad
Ethics are not the same as the law
Could make questions less direct, softer
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
Good references in workshops
Need to fix formatting issues

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. Academic argument is about using a student's own ideas and then supporting those ideas with proper evidence. For more information, students can read the chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Everything cited in the text must be in the references list and everything in the references list must be cited in text. (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more)

Try to look for more evidence to be fairer
Good research but referencing is messy
Have more books and journal articles as references
Better if answers showed more complex understanding
Need to improve referencing in writing
Need more research to achieve this
Read more widely, more authors
Experiement more with unique ideas

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve DISTINCTION, student must increase the quality to meet distinction requirements. Student needs to include a proper introduction. Read chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to include a proper conclusion. Read chapter about "How to write a conclusion." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should learn how to properly use in-text citations. Read chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Could be more consistent between parts
Should have included why you chose those laws
Personality tests are not a reliable way to evaluate someone else
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
Good references in workshops
Good presentation
Needs some additional research to achieve this

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT and DISTINCTION outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
Keep up the good work!
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Watch spelling errors on slides. Text could be bigger.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. There should be a good balance between using student's own ideas and the ideas of others as support. For more information, students can read the chapter about "Showing Understanding" and "The 80/20 rule." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Academic argument is about using a student's own ideas and then supporting those ideas with proper evidence. For more information, students can read the chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Writing is your creation and it should be beautiful. There is more information in the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) A presenter should never say "uh." These kinds of non-sense sounds make it more difficult for the audience to understand. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) English is very different in the way it is pronounced, so more practice will help you improve. (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
Keep up the good work! There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent) All references used in writing should be included on a reference list at the end of the work. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 3 out of 5 -- OK, but inconsistent)
Slides and other visual aids are key for the audience to understand a presentation. Remember to not have too much or too little information, use more images and fewer words (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) It is important to dress professionally for presentations. Jeans, sport shoes, t-shirts, etc. are not professional. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) When speaking, it is important that a presenter speaks loud enough that the entire audience can hear. (your performance level: 5 out of 5 -- Already great) Some text was a little small. When you dress professionally, remember to check your shoes.

StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments: To achieve MERIT, student must increase the quality to meet merit requirements. Student needs to include a proper introduction. Read chapter about "How to write an introduction." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student has too much unsupported opinion. Any claim which is not commonly understood to be true by everyone should be supported with academic evidence. (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student needs to improve understanding of "academic argument." Read chapter about "How to show understanding." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) Student should make their writing more beautiful. Read the chapter about "How to make your writing beautiful." (your performance level: 3 out of 5) All evaluations should be against a good set of criteria. (your performance level: 3 out of 5)

OutcomeResult.FirstTryComments: Performance criteria should be objectively measurable
More research and more references would be better
Could show more complexity in 2nd question
Always better to have accepted criteria when evaluating anything
Good references in workshops
Need to fix formatting issues
Do not depend on "easy websites" - use books and journal articles

StudentAssignment.OverallComments: Achieved all PASS and MERIT and DISTINCTION outcomes.
StudentAssignment.ImprovementComments:
Keep up the good work! There is one correct way to format in-text citations. More information can be found in the chapter about "Referencing" (your performance level: 2 out of 5 -- very weak, often incorrect)
Eye contact with the audience helps the audience to feel more connected to the presenter. A presenter should avoid looking at slides or looking around the room. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Body language is important in presentations. Do not be too stiff, use hands to gesture, and have good posture when presenting. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) Confidence is important. If a presenter is nervous, practice more and "act" confident. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more) A presentation should "flow" and a presenter should never repeat words. (your performance level: 4 out of 5 -- Good, but can improve more)

Creative way to show differences

Nice research included
Good connection to research
More reasons when concluding the type of conflict would help
Examples could be more detailed
Try to apply to your specific team more
Could be more detailed about evidence
Good research but referencing is messy
Good use of research
Better if answers showed more complex understanding
Need to improve referencing in writing
Could be even more perspectives by reading more
Good research throughout
